00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Helper Functions for the Configuration Framework
00044  *
00045  * OCTEON_CN68XX introduces a flexible hw interface configuration
00046  * scheme. To cope with this change and the requirements of
00047  * configurability for other system resources, e.g., IPD/PIP pknd and
00048  * PKO ports and queues, a configuration framework for the SDK is
00049  * designed. It has two goals: first to recognize and establish the
00050  * default configuration and, second, to allow the user to define key
00051  * parameters in a high-level language.
00052  *
00053  * The helper functions query the QLM setup to help achieving the
00054  * first goal.
00055  *
00056  * The second goal is accomplished by generating
00057  * cvmx_helper_cfg_init() from a high-level lanaguage.
00058  *
00059  * <hr>$Revision: 0 $<hr>
00060  */
00061 
00062 #ifndef __CVMX_HELPER_CFG_H__
00063 #define __CVMX_HELPER_CFG_H__
00064 
00065 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00066 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx-helper-util.h>
00067 #else
00068 #include "cvmx-helper-util.h"
00069 #endif
00070 
00071 #define CVMX_HELPER_CFG_MAX_PKO_PORT        128
00072 #define CVMX_HELPER_CFG_MAX_PIP_BPID        64
00073 #define CVMX_HELPER_CFG_MAX_PIP_PKND        64
00074 #define CVMX_HELPER_CFG_MAX_PKO_QUEUES      256
00075 #define CVMX_HELPER_CFG_MAX_PORT_PER_IFACE  256
00076 
00077 #define CVMX_HELPER_CFG_INVALID_VALUE       -1  /* The default return
00078                              * value upon failure
00079                              */
00080 
00081 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00082 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00083 extern "C" {
00084 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00085 #endif
00086 
00087 #define cvmx_helper_cfg_assert(cond)                    \
00088     do {                                \
00089         if (!(cond))                        \
00090         {                               \
00091             cvmx_dprintf("cvmx_helper_cfg_assert (%s) at %s:%d\n",  \
00092             #cond, __FILE__, __LINE__);             \
00093         }                               \
00094     } while (0)
00095 
00096 extern int cvmx_npi_max_pknds;
00097 
00098 /*
00099  * Config Options
00100  *
00101  * These options have to be set via cvmx_helper_cfg_opt_set() before calling the
00102  * routines that set up the hw. These routines process the options and set them
00103  * correctly to take effect at runtime.
00104  */
00105 enum cvmx_helper_cfg_option {
00106     CVMX_HELPER_CFG_OPT_USE_DWB,    /*
00107                      * Global option to control if
00108                      * the SDK configures units (DMA,
00109                      * SSO, and PKO) to send don't
00110                      * write back (DWB) requests for
00111                      * freed buffers. Set to 1/0 to
00112                      * enable/disable DWB.
00113                      *
00114                      * For programs that fit inside
00115                      * L2, sending DWB just causes
00116                      * more L2 operations without
00117                      * benefit.
00118                      */
00119 
00120     CVMX_HELPER_CFG_OPT_MAX
00121 };
00122 typedef enum cvmx_helper_cfg_option cvmx_helper_cfg_option_t;
00123 
00124 struct cvmx_phy_info;
00125 struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info;
00126 struct cvmx_vsc7224_chan;
00127 
00128 /*
00129  * Per physical port
00130  * Note: This struct is passed between linux and SE apps.
00131  */
00132 struct cvmx_cfg_port_param {
00133     int port_fdt_node;      /** Node offset in FDT of node */
00134     int phy_fdt_node;       /** Node offset in FDT of PHY */
00135     struct cvmx_phy_info *phy_info; /** Data structure with PHY information */
00136     int8_t ccpp_pknd;
00137     int8_t ccpp_bpid;
00138     int8_t ccpp_pko_port_base;
00139     int8_t ccpp_pko_num_ports;
00140     uint8_t agl_rx_clk_skew;    /** AGL rx clock skew setting (default 0) */
00141     uint8_t rgmii_tx_clk_delay; /** RGMII TX clock delay value if not bypassed */
00142     bool valid:1;           /** 1 = port valid, 0 = invalid */
00143     bool sgmii_phy_mode:1;      /** 1 = port in PHY mode, 0 = MAC mode */
00144     bool sgmii_1000x_mode:1;    /** 1 = 1000Base-X mode, 0 = SGMII mode */
00145     bool agl_rx_clk_delay_bypass:1; /** 1 = use rx clock delay bypass for AGL mode */
00146     bool force_link_up:1;       /** Ignore PHY and always report link up */
00147     bool disable_an:1;      /** true to disable autonegotiation */
00148     bool link_down_pwr_dn:1;    /** Power PCS off when link is down */
00149     bool phy_present:1;     /** true if PHY is present */
00150     bool tx_clk_delay_bypass:1; /** True to bypass the TX clock delay */
00151     bool enable_fec:1;      /** True to enable FEC for 10/40G links */
00152     uint8_t agl_refclk_sel;     /** RGMII refclk select to use */
00153     /** Set if local (non-PHY) LEDs are used */
00154     struct cvmx_phy_gpio_leds *gpio_leds;
00155     struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *sfp_info; /** SFP+/QSFP info for port */
00156     /** Offset of SFP/SFP+/QSFP slot in device tree */
00157     int sfp_of_offset;
00158     /** Microsemi VSC7224 channel info data structure */
00159     struct cvmx_vsc7224_chan *vsc7224_chan;
00160 };
00161 
00162 /*
00163  * Per pko_port
00164  */
00165 struct cvmx_cfg_pko_port_param {
00166     int16_t ccppp_queue_base;
00167     int16_t ccppp_num_queues;
00168 };
00169 
00170 /*
00171  * A map from pko_port to
00172  *     interface,
00173  *     index, and
00174  *     pko engine id
00175  */
00176 struct cvmx_cfg_pko_port_map {
00177     int16_t ccppl_interface;
00178     int16_t ccppl_index;
00179     int16_t ccppl_eid;
00180 };
00181 
00182 /*
00183  * This is for looking up pko_base_port and pko_nport for ipd_port
00184  */
00185 struct cvmx_cfg_pko_port_pair {
00186     int8_t ccppp_base_port;
00187     int8_t ccppp_nports;
00188 };
00189 
00190 typedef union cvmx_user_static_pko_queue_config
00191 {
00192     struct
00193     {
00194         struct pko_queues_cfg {
00195             unsigned
00196                 queues_per_port:5,
00197                 qos_enable:1,
00198                 pfc_enable:1;
00199         } pko_cfg_iface[6];
00200         struct pko_queues_cfg pko_cfg_loop;
00201         struct pko_queues_cfg pko_cfg_npi;
00202     } pknd;
00203     struct
00204     {
00205         uint8_t pko_ports_per_interface[5];
00206         uint8_t pko_queues_per_port_interface[5];
00207         uint8_t pko_queues_per_port_loop;
00208         uint8_t pko_queues_per_port_pci;
00209         uint8_t pko_queues_per_port_srio[4];
00210     } non_pknd;
00211 } cvmx_user_static_pko_queue_config_t;
00212 
00213 extern CVMX_SHARED cvmx_user_static_pko_queue_config_t __cvmx_pko_queue_static_config;
00214 extern CVMX_SHARED struct cvmx_cfg_pko_port_map cvmx_cfg_pko_port_map[CVMX_HELPER_CFG_MAX_PKO_PORT];
00215 extern CVMX_SHARED struct cvmx_cfg_port_param cvmx_cfg_port [CVMX_MAX_NODES][CVMX_HELPER_MAX_IFACE][CVMX_HELPER_CFG_MAX_PORT_PER_IFACE];
00216 extern CVMX_SHARED struct cvmx_cfg_pko_port_param cvmx_pko_queue_table[];
00217 extern CVMX_SHARED int cvmx_enable_helper_flag;
00218 /*
00219  * @INTERNAL
00220  * Return configured pknd for the port
00221  *
00222  * @param interface the interface number
00223  * @param index the port's index number
00224  * @return the pknd
00225  */
00226 extern int __cvmx_helper_cfg_pknd(int interface, int index);

00228 /*
00229  * @INTERNAL
00230  * Return the configured bpid for the port
00231  *
00232  * @param interface the interface number
00233  * @param index the port's index number
00234  * @return the bpid
00235  */
00236 extern int __cvmx_helper_cfg_bpid(int interface, int index);

00238 /**
00239  * @INTERNAL
00240  * Return the configured pko_port base for the port
00241  *
00242  * @param interface the interface number
00243  * @param index the port's index number
00244  * @return the pko_port base
00245  */
00246 extern int __cvmx_helper_cfg_pko_port_base(int interface, int index);
00247 
00248 /*
00249  * @INTERNAL
00250  * Return the configured number of pko_ports for the port
00251  *
00252  * @param interface the interface number
00253  * @param index the port's index number
00254  * @return the number of pko_ports
00255  */
00256 extern int __cvmx_helper_cfg_pko_port_num(int interface, int index);
00257 
00258 /*
00259  * @INTERNAL
00260  * Return the configured pko_queue base for the pko_port
00261  *
00262  * @param pko_port
00263  * @return the pko_queue base
00264  */
00265 extern int __cvmx_helper_cfg_pko_queue_base(int pko_port);
00266 
00267 /*
00268  * @INTERNAL
00269  * Return the configured number of pko_queues for the pko_port
00270  *
00271  * @param pko_port
00272  * @return the number of pko_queues
00273  */
00274 extern int __cvmx_helper_cfg_pko_queue_num(int pko_port);
00275 
00276 /*
00277  * @INTERNAL
00278  * Return the interface the pko_port is configured for
00279  *
00280  * @param pko_port
00281  * @return the interface for the pko_port
00282  */
00283 extern int __cvmx_helper_cfg_pko_port_interface(int pko_port);
00284 
00285 /*
00286  * @INTERNAL
00287  * Return the index of the port the pko_port is configured for
00288  *
00289  * @param pko_port
00290  * @return the index of the port
00291  */
00292 extern int __cvmx_helper_cfg_pko_port_index(int pko_port);
00293 
00294 /*
00295  * @INTERNAL
00296  * Return the pko_eid of the pko_port
00297  *
00298  * @param pko_port
00299  * @return the pko_eid
00300  */
00301 extern int __cvmx_helper_cfg_pko_port_eid(int pko_port);
00302 
00303 /*
00304  * @INTERNAL
00305  * Return the max# of pko queues allocated.
00306  *
00307  * @return the max# of pko queues
00308  *
00309  * Note: there might be holes in the queue space depending on user
00310  * configuration. The function returns the highest queue's index in
00311  * use.
00312  */
00313 extern int __cvmx_helper_cfg_pko_max_queue(void);
00314 
00315 /*
00316  * @INTERNAL
00317  * Return the max# of PKO DMA engines allocated.
00318  *
00319  * @return the max# of DMA engines
00320  *
00321  * NOTE: the DMA engines are allocated contiguously and starting from
00322  * 0.
00323  */
00324 extern int __cvmx_helper_cfg_pko_max_engine(void);
00325 
00326 /*
00327  * Get the value set for the config option ``opt''.
00328  *
00329  * @param opt is the config option.
00330  * @return the value set for the option
00331  *
00332  * LR: only used for DWB in NPI, POW, PKO1
00333  */
00334 extern uint64_t cvmx_helper_cfg_opt_get(cvmx_helper_cfg_option_t opt);
00335 
00336 /*
00337  * Set the value for a config option.
00338  *
00339  * @param opt is the config option.
00340  * @param val is the value to set for the opt.
00341  * @return 0 for success and -1 on error
00342  *
00343  * Note an option here is a config-time parameter and this means that
00344  * it has to be set before calling the corresponding setup functions
00345  * that actually sets the option in hw.
00346  *
00347  * LR: Not used.
00348  */
00349 extern int cvmx_helper_cfg_opt_set(cvmx_helper_cfg_option_t opt, uint64_t val);
00350 
00351 /*
00352  * Retrieve the pko_port base given ipd_port.
00353  *
00354  * @param ipd_port is the IPD eport
00355  * @return the corresponding PKO port base for the physical port
00356  * represented by the IPD eport or CVMX_HELPER_CFG_INVALID_VALUE.
00357  */
00358 extern int cvmx_helper_cfg_ipd2pko_port_base(int ipd_port);
00359 
00360 /*
00361  * Retrieve the number of pko_ports given ipd_port.
00362  *
00363  * @param ipd_port is the IPD eport
00364  * @return the corresponding number of PKO ports for the physical port
00365  *  represented by IPD eport or CVMX_HELPER_CFG_INVALID_VALUE.
00366  */
00367 extern int cvmx_helper_cfg_ipd2pko_port_num(int ipd_port);
00368 
00369 /*
00370  * @INTERNAL
00371  * The init function
00372  *
00373  * @param node
00374  * @return 0 for success.
00375  *
00376  * Note: this function is meant to be called to set the ``configured
00377  * parameters,'' e.g., pknd, bpid, etc. and therefore should be before
00378  * any of the corresponding cvmx_helper_cfg_xxxx() functions are
00379  * called.
00380  */
00381 extern int __cvmx_helper_init_port_config_data(int node);
00382 
00383 /*
00384  * @INTERNAL
00385  * The local init function
00386  *
00387  * @param none
00388  * @return 0 for success.
00389  *
00390  * Note: this function is meant to be called to set the ``configured
00391  * parameters locally,'' e.g., pknd, bpid, etc. and therefore should be before
00392  * any of the corresponding cvmx_helper_cfg_xxxx() functions are
00393  * called.
00394  */
00395 extern int __cvmx_helper_init_port_config_data_local(void);
00396 
00397 /*
00398  * Set the frame max size and jabber size to 65535.
00399  *
00400  */
00401 extern void cvmx_helper_cfg_set_jabber_and_frame_max(void);
00402 
00403 /*
00404  * Enable storing short packets only in the WQE.
00405  */
00406 extern void cvmx_helper_cfg_store_short_packets_in_wqe(void);
00407 
00408 /*
00409  * Allocated a block of internal ports and queues for the specified
00410  * interface/port
00411  *
00412  * @param  interface  the interface for which the internal ports and queues
00413  *                    are requested
00414  * @param  port       the index of the port within in the interface for which
00415                       the internal ports and queues are requested.
00416  * @param  pot_count  the number of internal ports requested
00417  * @param  queue_cnt  the number of queues requested for each of the internal
00418  *                    port. This call will allocate a total of
00419  *            (port_cnt * queue_cnt) queues
00420  *
00421  * @return  0 on success
00422  *         -1 on failure
00423  *
00424  * LR: Called ONLY from comfig-parse!
00425  */
00426  int cvmx_pko_alloc_iport_and_queues(int interface, int port, int port_cnt,
00427                      int queue_cnt);
00428 
00429 /*
00430  * Free the queues that are associated with the specified port
00431  *
00432  * @param  port   the internal port for which the queues are freed.
00433  *
00434  * @return  0 on success
00435  *         -1 on failure
00436  */
00437 int cvmx_pko_queue_free(uint64_t port);
00438 
00439 /*
00440  * Initializes the pko queue range data structure.
00441  * @return  0 on success
00442  *         -1 on failure
00443  */
00444 int init_cvmx_pko_que_range(void);
00445 
00446 /*
00447  * Frees up all the allocated ques.
00448  */
00449 void cvmx_pko_queue_free_all(void);
00450 
00451 /**
00452  * Returns if port is valid for a given interface
00453  *
00454  * @param xiface     interface to check
00455  * @param index      port index in the interface
00456  *
00457  * @return status of the port present or not.
00458  */
00459 int cvmx_helper_is_port_valid(int xiface, int index);
00460 
00461 /**
00462  * Set whether or not a port is valid
00463  *
00464  * @param interface interface to set
00465  * @param index     port index to set
00466  * @param valid     set 0 to make port invalid, 1 for valid
00467  */
00468 void cvmx_helper_set_port_valid(int interface, int index, bool valid);
00469 
00470 /**
00471  * @INTERNAL
00472  * Return if port is in PHY mode
00473  *
00474  * @param interface the interface number
00475  * @param index the port's index number
00476  *
00477  * @return 1 if port is in PHY mode, 0 if port is in MAC mode
00478  */
00479 extern bool cvmx_helper_get_mac_phy_mode(int interface, int index);
00480 extern void cvmx_helper_set_mac_phy_mode(int interface, int index, bool valid);
00481 
00482 /**
00483  * @INTERNAL
00484  * Return if port is in 1000Base X mode
00485  *
00486  * @param interface the interface number
00487  * @param index the port's index number
00488  *
00489  * @return 1 if port is in 1000Base X mode, 0 if port is in SGMII mode
00490  */
00491 extern bool cvmx_helper_get_1000x_mode(int interface, int index);
00492 extern void cvmx_helper_set_1000x_mode(int interface, int index, bool valid);
00493 
00494 /**
00495  * @INTERNAL
00496  * Return if an AGL port should bypass the RX clock delay
00497  *
00498  * @param interface the interface number
00499  * @param index the port's index number
00500  */
00501 extern bool cvmx_helper_get_agl_rx_clock_delay_bypass(int interface, int index);
00502 extern void cvmx_helper_set_agl_rx_clock_delay_bypass(int interface, int index,
00503                               bool valid);
00504 
00505 /**
00506  * @INTERNAL
00507  * Forces a link to always return that it is up ignoring the PHY (if present)
00508  *
00509  * @param interface the interface number
00510  * @param index the port's index
00511  */
00512 extern bool cvmx_helper_get_port_force_link_up(int interface, int index);
00513 extern void cvmx_helper_set_port_force_link_up(int interface, int index,
00514                            bool value);
00515 
00516 /**
00517  * @INTERNAL
00518  * Return true if PHY is present to the passed xiface
00519  *
00520  * @param xiface the interface number
00521  * @param index the port's index
00522  */
00523 extern bool cvmx_helper_get_port_phy_present(int xiface, int index);
00524 extern void cvmx_helper_set_port_phy_present(int xiface, int index,
00525                          bool value);
00526 
00527 /**
00528  * @INTERNAL
00529  * Return the AGL port rx clock skew, only used
00530  * if agl_rx_clock_delay_bypass is set.
00531  *
00532  * @param interface the interface number
00533  * @param index the port's index number

00535 extern uint8_t cvmx_helper_get_agl_rx_clock_skew(int interface, int index);

00537                           uint8_t value);

00540                           uint8_t value);

00586 /**
00587  * @INTERNAL
00588  * Override default autonegotiation for a port
00589  *
00590  * @param xiface    node and interface
00591  * @param index     port index
00592  * @param enable    true to enable autonegotiation, false to force full
00593  *          duplex, full speed.
00594  */
00595 extern void cvmx_helper_set_port_autonegotiation(int xiface, int index,
00596                          bool enable);
00597 
00598 /**
00599  * @INTERNAL
00600  * Returns if autonegotiation is enabled or not.
00601  *
00602  * @param xiface    node and interface
00603  * @param index     port index
00604  *
00605  * @return 0 if autonegotiation is disabled, 1 if enabled.
00606  */
00607 extern bool cvmx_helper_get_port_autonegotiation(int xiface, int index);

00615  *
00616  * @return 0 if fec is disabled, 1 if enabled.
00617  */

00675 /**

00677  * Disables RGMII TX clock bypass and sets delay value
00678  *
00679  * @param xiface    node and interface
00680  * @param index     portindex
00681  * @param bypass    Set true to enable the clock bypass and false
00682  *          to sync clock and data synchronously.
00683  *          Default is false.
00684  * @param clk_delay Delay value to skew TXC from TXD
00685  */
00686 void cvmx_helper_cfg_set_rgmii_tx_clk_delay( int xiface, int index,
00687                          bool bypass, int clk_delay);
00688

00692  *
00693  * @param xiface    node and interface
00694  * @param index     portindex
00695  * @param bypass    Set true to enable the clock bypass and false
00696  *          to sync clock and data synchronously.
00697  *          Default is false.
00698  * @param clk_delay Delay value to skew TXC from TXD, default is 0.
00699  */
00700 void cvmx_helper_cfg_get_rgmii_tx_clk_delay(int xiface, int index,
00701                         bool *bypass,
00702                         int *clk_delay);
